name: plkeyb.vim
description:
Polish letters in iso-8859-2 encoding. 
Press "~" (tilde), then [ACELNOSZXacelnoszx] to insert polish equiv.
NEW :
'keymap' version. Unzip the file in your $VIMRUNTIME/keymap or $HOME/.vim/keymap directory.
You'll be able to select the new 'polish' keymap from Edit/Keymap menu.
Activate with Edit/Keymap/polish or :set keymap=polish.
install_details:
copy this into your ~/.vim/keymap directory  (or use system-wide keymap dir).
Of course you'll have to set the proper screen font (supporting iso8859-2 or UTF-8 encoding)

versions.release_notes: Hopefully a bit better version. I can edit (ON MY SYSTEM -- YMMV -- pls report) utf-8 and iso-8859-2 files now. Check your *encodings...
